titleStmt.title: The most sacred Bible, whiche is the Holy Scripture conteyning the Old and New Testament / translated into English, and newly recognised with great diligence after most faythful exemplars, by Rychard Taverner.
Bible. English. Taverner. 1539.
titleStmt.author: Taverner, Richard, 1505?-1575.

publicationStmt.publisher: Prynted at London in Fletestrete at the sygne of the Sonne by John Byddell, for Thomas Barthlet,

notesStmt.note: Apocrypha and New Testament each have special t.p.
Signatures: [pi]4 [2 hands]6 [3 hands]6 A-2O6 2P8, 2A-2O6 2P8 3A-3M6 3N4, A-I6 L-Q6 R8. Quire K lacking in all known copies.
This is a replacement copy for incomplete British Library filming on reel 83.
Reel guide erroneously lists this item as being on reel 1764.
Imperfect: tightly bound with slight loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Cambridge University Library.

place.placeName: London in Fletestrete at the sygne of the Sonne
